 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (AudioStreamOut)

Detailed Description

The AudioStreamOut class manages and plays a single audio resource for applications.

It allows to stream PCM audio buffers to the audio hardware for playback.

The following example demonstrates how to use the AudioStreamOut. 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {

           //Initial argument of getFitBufferSize function.
           int32_t sampleRateHz = 44100;
           int32_t channel = AudioControl::CHANNEL_CONFIGURATION_MONO;
           int32_t audioFormat = AudioControl::ENCODING_PCM_16BIT;

           // Increase the ringer volume.
           int32_t playBufSize = AudioStreamOut::getFitBufferSize(sampleRateHz,
               channel, audioFormat);

           // New a AudioStreamOut instance.
           AudioStreamOut *mpAudioStreamOut = new AudioStreamOut(AudioControl::STREAM_MUSIC, sampleRateHz,
               channel, audioFormat, playBufSize, AudioStreamOut::MODE_STREAM);

           // New a listener which by user created and should override
           // callback function.
           MyAudioStreamOutListener *mpl = new MyAudioStreamOutListener();

           // set a listener
           AudioStreamOut->setPalybackListener(mpl);

           // Create a buffer array for recording the streaming.
           Array<short> buffer(playBufSize);

           // Write data to buffer
           AudioStreamOut->writeStreamingBuffer(buffer, 0, buffer.length);

           // Starts playing an AudioStreamOut.
           AudioStreamOut->startStreamingOut();

           // Stops playing the audio data.
           mpAudioStreamIn->stopGetStreaming();

 }

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::InitialState

The inital status of AudioStreamOut.

Enumerator:
STATE_UNINITIALIZED 

State of an AudioStreamOut that was not successfully initialized upon creation.

STATE_INITIALIZED 

State of an AudioStreamOut that is ready to be used.

STATE_NO_STATIC_DATA 

State of a successfully initialized AudioStreamOut that uses static data, but that hasn't received that data yet.

Definition at line 90 of file AudioStreamOut.h.

enum gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::PlayState

The play status of AudioStreamOut.

Enumerator:
PLAYSTATE_STOPPED 

indicates AudioStreamOut state is stopped

PLAYSTATE_PAUSED 

indicates AudioStreamOut state is paused

PLAYSTATE_PLAYING 

indicates AudioStreamOut state is playing

enum gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::State

The setting state of Audio.

Enumerator:
SUCCESS 

Denotes a successful operation.

ERROR 

Denotes a generic operation failure.

ERROR_BAD_VALUE 

Denotes a failure due to the use of an invalid value.

ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION 

Denotes a failure due to the improper use of a method.

Definition at line 136 of file AudioStreamOut.h.

enum gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::StreamMode

The stream mode of audio.

Enumerator:
MODE_STATIC 

Creation mode where audio data is transferred only once before the audio starts playing.

MODE_STREAM 

Creation mode where audio data is streamed as the audio is playing.

Definition at line 71 of file AudioStreamOut.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::AudioStreamOut ( AudioControl::StreamType  streamType,
int32_t  sampleRateInHz,
AudioControl::ChannelValue  channelConfig,
AudioControl::EncodingType  audioFormat,
int32_t  bufferSizeInBytes,
StreamMode  mode 
)

Class constructor.

Parameters:
streamTypethe type of the audio stream. See AudioControl#STREAM_VOICE_CALL, AudioControl#STREAM_SYSTEM, AudioControl#STREAM_RING, AudioControl#STREAM_MUSIC and AudioControl#STREAM_ALARM
sampleRateInHzthe sample rate expressed in Hertz. Examples of rates are (but not limited to) 44100, 22050 and 11025.
channelConfigdescribes the configuration of the audio channels. See AudioControl#CHANNEL_CONFIGURATION_MONO and AudioControl#CHANNEL_CONFIGURATION_STEREO
audioFormatthe format in which the audio data is represented. See AudioControl#ENCODING_PCM_16BIT and AudioControl#ENCODING_PCM_8BIT
bufferSizeInBytesthe total size (in bytes) of the buffer where audio data is read from for playback. If using the AudioStreamOut in streaming mode, you can write data into this buffer in smaller chunks than this size. If using the AudioStreamOut in static mode, this is the maximum size of the sound that will be played for this instance. See getFitBufferSize(int, int, int) to determine the minimum required buffer size for the successful creation of an AudioStreamOut instance in streaming mode. Using values smaller than getFitBufferSize() will result in an initialization failure.
modestreaming or static buffer. See MODE_STATIC and MODE_STREAM
virtual gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::~AudioStreamOut ( ) [virtual]

Class disconstruct, use this disconstructor when the AudioStreamOut want to release it's resource.

static int32_t gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::getFitBufferSize ( int32_t  sampleRateHz,
int32_t  channel,
int32_t  audioFormat 
) [static]

Returns the minimum buffer size required for creating a new straming out track according to given samplerate, channel and format.

This buffer size is suggested value for you to fill in the buffer which you wants to play.

Parameters:
sampleRateHzthe sample rate expressed in Hertz. For example set 44100, 48000
channeldescribes the audio channels which you want to set Select 0 for MONO output Select 1 for STEREO output
audioFormatthe format which audio PCM data you want ot set Select 0 for PCM 8 BIT Select 1 for PCM 16 BIT

void gaia::media::AudioStreamOut::setPlaybackListener ( const IAudioStreamOutListener &  listener)

Sets the listener the AudioStreamOut notifies when a previously set marker is reached or for each periodic playback head position update.

Notifications will be received in the same thread as the one in which the AudioStreamOut instance was created.

Parameters:
listenerregister a listener to call a callback function.
